body: Good job to escape the `<>` with `< >` when displaying HTML tags on the page. :+1:

`<h1>` is for the most important heading on the page. It usually  has one on a page. We could use a `<h2>` tag for subheadings. There is quite [a lot of tags for headings](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/Heading_Elements).

A valid HTML has a structure below.

```
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
    <head>
        <meta charset="utf-8">
        <title>Page Title</title>
    </head>
    <body>
        <article>This is an article.</article>
    </body>
</html>
```
